DarkHawk/Perceptor:

Perceptor motioned to Rodimus to follow him. When they=
 are away of the other bots he insolates the corritor and he blunty said "Z=
arak is planning sometihing... Literaly I sense it, Hydras must be informed=
 his desires to get the Matrix, altough he mentions that was for us I think=
 that the right pronoun is he... He must be observed in a discrete way, i w=
ont let him go close to the Ark, the slightes tampering in the wrong way an=
d all is doomed, and we dont know a lot about Scourge and Cyclonus; I'll in=
sist Hydras, that let us go me and Darkhawk but I need someone watching Zar=
ak, but that would be after we get all the info that we can from that Auto-=
fool " 

**************

DarkHawk took one of his guns and aimed carfully, =
ready for all.




From: supercyclonus 
Sent: Monday, February 22, 2010 4:1=
6 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortr=
ess


  
>"I remind you, Zarak, that you and Jiaxus are our guest
>in the B=
lackFortess" said coldyPerceptor "and not the Master of the house, so
>reme=
mber where is your place; Darkhawk, take this... Patetic bot to the
>intero=
gation chamber, you and Zarak take every piece of information that
>coudl b=
e usefull, even if that means to use painful means; when you have a good
>a=
mount of information we can go to take the matrix...

(SNIP)

Zarak straigh=
tened, crossing his arms over his chest as he coolly looked at Perceptor. "=
Of course" he said, the look on his face a cold blank mask, revealing nothi=
ng of the inner turmoil he was dealing with. There was a part of him that w=
anted to blast the little Predacon for daring to tell him anything. But the=
 ugly thing was that Zarak still needed the extra forces that Hydras and hi=
s Predacons brought to the table.

So rather than commanding his Scorponok =
unit to open fire on the base he just nodded and said, "I apologize, I have=
 overstepped my place."

Meanwhile Cyclonus and Scourge continued to face d=
own Dark Rodimus, the air was tense as Dark Rodimus' optics stared into Cyc=
lonus, niether of them ready to back down, both of them remembering the las=
t battle they fought!

However it was Perceptor that broke the deadlock as =
he continued giving orders . . . 

(PASTE)

> The rest, we have to Keep an =
eye in maximal base things are becoming
> interesting lately there, Rodimus=
... I need you for task"

The affect of the command was almost instant as R=
odimus stepped back from Cyclonus and Scourge and looked over at Perceptor.=
 "What'cha need Percy?" Rodimus said to Perceptor, happy for the moment tha=
t it was Perceptor and Hydras giving orders and not Cyclonus and his lap do=
g.

Cyclonus, seeing the break in the tension also stepped back, pulling Sc=
ourge back with him. "There will be another time Scourge." he said quietly,=
 "No need to fight this out here."

Scourge nodded, "Yes, there will be." h=
e said darkly. His optics still watched Rodimus, his look almost hungry as =
he smiled evilly.

As the tensions between Cyclonus, Scourge and Rodimus co=
oled Zarak turned to look at Tuscon, wondering what information this bot co=
uld hold. "Come" Zarak said to Darkhawk, "Let's see what this Auto . . . "
=

*BEEP*

Zarak was caught in mid sentence by his scanner going off, the han=
d held one that he had been keeping trained on Tuscon. He glanced down at i=
t, a curious look on his face. For some reason it was registering a life si=
gn where there had been none before. It was located somewhere near Tuscon's=
 head.

Zarak stepped forward to take a more careful scan . . .

(TAG)

OOC=
: Yup, the same scanner he had been scanning him with a few posts ago. It i=
s still out and processing :) 

Preston
(Cyclonus/Scourge/Rodimus/Zarak)


=
